meanings.definition: The state of accompanying or occurring with something else.
meanings.sent1: The concomitance of rain and thunder made the storm even more frightening.
meanings.sent2: The concomitance of laughter and joy filled the room with happiness.
meanings.sent3: The concomitance of a cat and a dog sharing a bed was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The concomitance of music and dance created a harmonious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The concomitance of colors and shapes in the painting was truly mesmerizing.

meanings.sent1: The concomitance of the sunrise and the birds chirping signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent2: The concomitance of the crowd cheering and the fireworks lighting up the sky was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The concomitance of a clown and a magician at the party added an unexpected twist.
meanings.sent4: The concomitance of waves crashing and seagulls soaring painted a picture of tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The concomitance of flavors and aromas in the kitchen created a delightful cooking experience.
